briefTitle: A 12-week Extension Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Brexpiprazole in the Treatment of Subjects With Agitation Associated With Dementia of the Alzheimer's Type
officialTitle: A 12-week, Multicenter, Active-treatment Extension Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Brexpiprazole in the Treatment of Subjects With Agitation Associated With Dementia of the Alzheimer's Type
summary: Active treatment extension study of the 331-14-213 trial, to assess the long-term safety and tolerability of oral brexpiprazole as treatment in adult participants with agitation associated with dementia of the Alzheimer's type (AAD).

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) by Severity
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From first dose through 30 days after last dose of study drug (Up to approximately Week 16)
